content.description: A short 5.8 lieback sequence leads to easy scrambling.  Near the top, a bolt protects a fun 5.8 face exit.
content.protection: One bolt and a light rack of gear
content.location: This is on the face near the left end of the wall, just left of Trivial Pursuit.

climbs.name: Trivial Pursuit
climbs.fa: Alan Nelson and Vaino Kodas, December 1984

content.description: This is a high quality but very runout face climb.  The most serious runout is getting up to the second bolt.
content.location: Near the left end of the wall is a relatively large face.  This route is near the right side of this face.

climbs.name: Trivia Quiz
climbs.fa: Don Reid and Alan Bartlett, January 1992

content.description: Climb a trough to right-facing corner system, pass a small roof about thirty feet up, and continue up a crack to the top.
content.location:
Thirty feet right of

Trivial Pursuit

.

climbs.name: No Ambition
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Mike Morretti, November, 2016

content.description: Climb the face just right of Bald Ambition, joining Bald Ambition at its last bolt.

Traverses just under the obvious and inviting roof (about 30' off the ground) that connects Trivia Quiz 5.7 to First of Many 5.8.  Start on Trivia Quiz, traverse with hands under the roof and around the corner into the top of Trivia Quiz.

This climbs the chimney to the right of a roof about thirty feet off the ground. This chimney is chossy and sparsely protected.

I guess it's worth doing, if you like groveling or want to do every route in the park. I don't recall having that exhilarating of a time on it.

climbs.name: Bald Ambition
climbs.fa: Dave Evans, Todd Gordon and Jim Angione, December 1995

content.description: Scramble up easy terrain to the base and set a belay then start up an easy right-facing corner with a bolt, pull a small overlap and then make a few tricky moves (crux) past two bolts.
content.location:
Around and left of

Where's Baldo?

on the edge of the face.
